data.title: Code suggestions not appearing for function parameters in C

- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Define a C function with multiple parameters (any type)
2. In the function body, begin to type one of the parameter names

Expected:

Parameter name should appear in suggestions.

Observed:

Parameter name does not appear in suggestions.

data.title: Performance regression while starting up
data.body:
Our telemetry data shows that the startup performance of `1.9.0-insider` is worse than that of `1.8.1`. Drilling into this shows that it takes a lot longer to get the extension host ready event, so the timespan between the `perfBeforeExtensionLoad` and `perfAfterExtensionLoad` timer ticks. The profiler shows that the configuration service takes ~230ms doing something once the extensions have registered their configurations (with 1.8 this takes ~30ms).

![screen shot 2017-01-26 at 15 03 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/22334005/329e0ff2-e3d9-11e6-9ae8-3cc8a3dd9744.png)

The offender is `lookup` and isn't new to me. I might be wrong but I remember that there was already a similar perf issue a while back. 

![screen shot 2017-01-26 at 15 01 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/22333999/2d2e7854-e3d9-11e6-9a67-c427fc4d9ea8.png)

[master-exthost-ready.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/732456/master-exthost-ready.cpuprofile.zip)
[release1.8-exthost-ready.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/732457/release1.8-exthost-ready.cpuprofile.zip)

data.title: ES2015 Classes not highlighting correctly
data.body:
For some reason VSCode will not highlight the ES2015 class seen on the left in the same way it does in the traditional class on the right. Is this intended? Can I make it highlight in the same way?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1833542/22334007/d43f13d2-e3d0-11e6-8537-712a8eb9bf58.png)

data.title: 'Show' vs. 'reveal' word in settings and commands
data.body:
I got recently confused by this:

- There is an explorer.auto**Reveal** settings that implements this behavior: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3062. I set that value to `false`.
- To **reveal** the file in manually, I searched the command palette and indeed found "**Reveal** Active File in Windows Explorer".
- I didn't notice that it mentions _Windows_ Explorer specifically (my bad) and was confused by the resulting action.
- I had somewhat hard time to find the right command. It turned turned out to be "**Show** Active File in Explorer".

I think that more consistent would be if **reveal** a file would always mean in VSCode's explorer while for opening anything externally, I'd use the word **open**. For example, "Open Active File in Windows Explorer".

data.title: TypeScript Rename File Refactoring
data.body:
When moving a file (drag'n drop), we then have to manually change every path where we used that file.

It would be nice to update all the `import` where we used that file.

data.title: lodash in bundled git extensions takes 4.8M
data.body:
Looking at the latest [VSCode-darwin-insider](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/insider/6ba4282fd27bacacbf8482472a0519560720fb9c/VSCode-darwin-insider.zip) build, it shows that the new git extension takes 5.4M.
From that 4.8M is the lodash node module.

 20K	/extensions/git/node_modules/denodeify/test
 40K	/extensions/git/node_modules/denodeify
1.6M	/extensions/git/node_modules/lodash/fp
4.8M	/extensions/git/node_modules/lodash
 12K	/extensions/git/node_modules/vscode-nls/lib
 28K	/extensions/git/node_modules/vscode-nls
4.9M	/extensions/git/node_modules
4.0K	/extensions/git/out/typings/globals/denodeify
4.0K	/extensions/git/out/typings/globals/lodash
8.0K	/extensions/git/out/typings/globals
8.0K	/extensions/git/out/typings
328K	/extensions/git/out
 48K	/extensions/git/resources/icons/dark
 48K	/extensions/git/resources/icons/light
 96K	/extensions/git/resources/icons
 96K	/extensions/git/resources
5.4M	/extensions/git

data.title: TypeError when debugging with node2
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: 6.9.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debug mocha tests with node2 (using babel to transpile) see full launch.json config below
2. sourcemaps: true

Full stack trace:
******** Unhandled error in debug adapter - Unhandled promise rejection: TypeError: Column must be greater than or equal to 0, got -1
    at SourceMapConsumer_findMapping [as _findMapping] (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\source-map\lib\source-map-consumer.js:543:13)
    at SourceMapConsumer_generatedPositionFor [as generatedPositionFor] (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\source-map\lib\source-map-consumer.js:748:22)
    at SourceMap.generatedPositionFor (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\sourceMaps\sourceMap.js:159:34)
    at SourceMaps.mapToGenerated (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\sourceMaps\sourceMaps.js:28:18)
    at args.breakpoints.forEach.bp (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\transformers\baseSourceMapTransformer.js:63:53)
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at EagerSourceMapTransformer.setBreakpoints (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\transformers\baseSourceMapTransformer.js:61:34)

Full config:
``` 
{
      "type": "node2",
      "name": "Debug Tests",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\node_modules\\mocha\\bin\\_mocha",
      	// Automatically stop program after launch.
			"stopOnEntry": false,
			// Command line arguments passed to the program.
      "args": ["--recursive", "src/test", "--compilers", "js:frontend-common/register,js:./src/test/css-modules-compiler.js", "--require", "src/test/setup.js", "--require", "source-map-support/register"],
			// Workspace relative or absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. Default is the current workspace.
			"cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
			// Workspace relative or absolute path to the runtime executable to be used. Default is the runtime executable on the PATH.
			"runtimeExecutable": null,
      "sourceMaps": true,
			// Environment variables passed to the program.
			"env": { "NODE_ENV": "development"}
    }
```

data.title: Use top bar for all confirmation dialogs
data.body:
UX: currently, VS Code uses two styles of confirmation dialogs:

**1\. The top bar**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/101152/22330985/3de0a632-e3c9-11e6-8845-9647a48fd737.png)

**2\. System dialog**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/101152/22331557/6124e7b8-e3cc-11e6-9110-7585e5faf6e7.png)

It would be nice to unify those, I think that the first style fits the overall UI much better.

data.title: Update ghooks (deprecated) devDependency
data.body:
Hi,

ghooks has been [deprecated](https://github.com/gtramontina/ghooks) in favor of husky. If you want to migrate, this PR updates `package.json` to use husky instead.

Husky will automatically migrate hooks installed in `.git/hooks`.

data.title: Snippet mode is left on editor blur
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. inserting a snippet to be more specific one with more than one tab trigger ($1,$2,$3 etc.)
2. insert the snippet 
3. insert text at first ($1) possition
4. change to another windows window e.g. Browser Window or a Notpad Window (no difference between switching via mouse or alt+tab)
5.  copy somthing you wanna past into vscode
6. switch back to vscode window
7. press tab to go to next position ($2)

at this point it fails instead of going to next position ($2) it does the normal context based thing as if the file already existed

i thought this whole thing may be caused due to the fact that i have set my vscode to save/persist file on loosing focus - it isn't i have tested this already by disabling autosave at all (also i have restarted the editor after this change sinze it may be affecting only new sessions) - still the same it looses the focus

can someone check if its only me or also for others

data.title: Add window.restoreZenMode option
data.body: I'd like code to open in Zen mode so I'm distraction-free immediately. There's already a `window.restoreFullscreen` which does the equivalent for fullscreen mode, but it would be great to be able to go that one step further and "boot up" in zen mode.

data.title: Inform the user that switching the used TypeScript version requires a restart
data.body:
See the attached movie. Notice that switching to the locally installed TypeScript version has only an effect after a restart since the typescript server is already running. We should inform the user that the change is in effect after restart.

data.title: tsdk: changing TS version from status bar does not update it in the status bar
data.body:
Testing the new TS status bar:
* have a workspace with NPM installed typescript@next
* open the workspace
* click on the status bar and change to TS 2.2.next
=> after doing so the status bar is still showing 2.1.5 being used.

data.title: Autocomplete / Intellisense stopped working
data.body:
After some time JavaScript autocomplete completely stopped working for my project. It worked at some point but then it stopped and I didn't notice it until a while ago.

However, if I create a new project with one file and type "console.", method suggestions pop up, i.e. autocomplete works in a new project.

I tried deleting the .vscode/ folder, and also typings/, jsconfig.json, etc, but it didn't help.

I think it might be caused by large amounts of JS code in third-party libraries. The project uses Ionic (version 1, no TypeScript), so there are a lot of code in dependencies as well as a bunch of other stuff in node_modules/.

VS Code version: 1.8.1
OS: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

data.title: Make PHP binary location configurable in user settings only
reindent lines break backtick strings
data.body:
re #19091

```ts
if (true) {
console.log(`
Hello, World
`);
}
```

* have above snippet in JS or TS
* trigger reindent
* :bug: The third line get indented and breaks the backtick formatted string

data.title: Keyboard stops working after holding a key down in an editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|dart-code|DanTup|0.14.9|
|fish|TeddyDD|0.0.4|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.2|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.4.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.52|
|java|redhat|0.0.9|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.1.2|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new vs code window.
2. With the focus in an editor, hold the 'j' key down (or any letter).

Expected: To see multiple 'j's
Actual: Window stops responding to any key presses that don't have a meta-key held down as well (e.g. command-z still works)
